Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2009 02:38AM mooma wrote: Suegmomof3....you need to write a book!  I can just imagine how you felt when you arrived at your ps office! Dianne, I went back to work this week, too.  I worked Sunday from 9 to 1 and thought I would never make it.  I went in yesterday morning at 9 and made it until 5:30 and felt better than I did the first short day.   I'm hoping today will even be better.  I only work three days a week so I'll have the rest of the week to relax.  Hope work is going well for you and I agree, I think it's going to be a struggle as long as these expanders are in.  I can't wait until I can sleep on my side! Samiam...advil thins you blood, that's why most of us are told tylonel, only.
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2009 04:13AM mooma wrote: Terri....I really feel for you.  We have all been there and making that decision is one of the hardest things to do in this whole nightmare.  Once you make your decision you will feel like you can move forward.  I know it sounds impossible right now but it will happen.  We are all here for you and just know that this website will be one of your best friends throughout this journey! I agree with Dani....3 weeks is too long for anyone to wait for results!  Yikes! Sue...I can relate to the 'shirt too tight' syndrome.  Every once in a while I think 'I'm going to go take this darned bra off'....Ha...no bra!!!
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2009 12:14PM mooma wrote: Ok girls...three cheers for Xanax!!! lol  I discovered another trick for sleeping.  I have taken Tylenol PM a few times and that knocks you out.  I have had a hard time sleeping through the night since I went through menopause but now I think it's vital to get good sleep. Hope4cure....I don't know if there is a name for the fat injecting procedure.  I'm going to have to research that one.  I was so happy to hear my ps say it, I asked no questions!  I too have that cold feeling when I drink....I can't tell where it goes but it sure is a strange feeling!  Dani...I've tried different sports bras, too.  Nothing works.  My ps said no bras.  I have been wearing chamois under my shirts when I go to work.  I live in FL so I'm not sure what I will do when it gets to be summer!  I tried to sit out in the sun today, in a bathing suite and that was not comfortable either...my dh said, "Take the damn thing off!!"  I went back in the house and poured myself a glass of wine....my drug of choice. TXbadboob...I had that pain, as well.  Mine started when I first tried going for a ride in the car and everytime I opend the door of the car or closed it the pain would start.  So for me it was any side movement that caused it.  I haven't had any of it for the last week or so.  I'm four weeks out.  Driving is still difficult.  If I could just drive in a straight line I'd be fine!! lol
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2009 12:04PM mooma wrote: Ok you February 23rd girls...we are almost there!!  I've had a rough two weeks leading up to this.  I was bragging that I never get sick...like a common cold and wham!!!  I got so sick!  Feeling great now.  Maybe that was a blessing to take my mind off my surgery. My prayers will be with you girls, Dani42 & AmandaBinNJ...I feel like we are partners in this! lol God Bless all of you!

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2009 07:22AM mooma wrote: Ann...I can't believe you are 6 weeks out already!!  Of course I can't believe I'm having my surgery tomorrow, either!  It sounds like you are doing great....I hope I made the right decisions for myself.  Some of that panic is trying to creep in today. You are right Jill.  I went for a massage yesterday with one of my daughters and had breakfast...it was a great thing to do.
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2009 06:14AM mooma wrote: Good morning girls.  I saw my ps yesterday and I, too, have a dark spot on the bottom part of my breast.  He gave me some medication to apply and I also have to call every day to tell them how much fluid I'm putting out and about the color of my nipples.  So far they are still looking good.  I have to be under 30 cc's for my tubes to come out.  Feeling pretty yucky from the anti-biotics but that's normal for me; can't wait until I'm done with them.  The sharp pain I feel in my nipples is from me contracting the muscles in my chest so I'm trying hard not to lift or push anything. The good news is, after I get my implants, he is going to suck some fat out of my belly and inject it in my chest to fill everything in!!  YEAH!!  A bonus! Yes, Dani...concrete or steel...I don't get it.
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2009 04:00AM mooma wrote: Hope4cure...I can really relate to the "background noise"!!! lol  I'm beginning to think it won't go completely away until the expanders are out.  I can lay flat on my back...which is strange because before surgery I couldn't because of my back.  I have told my dh and my ps when I have been lying flat and I sit up my expanders feel like they are scrapping against my chest on the inside (they look at me like I have two heads!!)...it has been excruciating until this morning.  This was the first morning I woke up, sat up and didn't feel that pain...just a slight tugging.  All in all, I think it's all about time and how quickly our bodies heal.  Did your ps say you had to keep your expanders in for 6 months?  So far mine has said 4 months but I see him Thursday and we know how quickly that can change!
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2009 04:27AM mooma wrote: Thanks, Bee....and you know that you will be all prayed up on the 21st! Caligrl...I raised 4 kids, all grown now.  I can't even imagine going through bc and STILL playing the 'good mom' roll.  I give you allot of credit, you've been through more than most of us during this time and you are still hanging in here helping others.  I think you are a pretty amazing woman! my560sel, I had a nipple sparing bm.  I feel very confident in my surgeon's judgment; he has done many and his brother is in research at Moffitt.  I found, in my search to find the best surgeon for me, when they didn't want to do something or tried to convince me it wasn't a good choice, it was because they weren't experienced in the procedure.  Just do you homework and become an expert like all the other ladies on here and you will be able to make the right decisions for 'you'. Amen....on some dr. should have been coroners, caligrl!!

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2009 10:54AM mooma wrote: Dani....I know how you feel.  I'm at work right now and it's going pretty well.  I had that sharp pain experience with opening and closing (pulling) the car door.  They ordered a muscle relaxer for me but I never picked it up...it was $58 with my insurance!  Anyway, I found if I didn't pull with my arm the pain went away.  Three or four months with these expanders in seems like an eternity!!  I am doing ok with the Tylenol, though.  Every once in a while I take a pergocet and that helps me to be pain free for a while....it's just that it makes me sick.  I know you want to feel better quickly but remember you just had major surgery and not only surgery but you have foreign substance in you that is poking and prodding you...and it feels like you are carrying steel on your chest!!  Tomorrow is a new day!!  I am praying for you girl!
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2009 04:03AM mooma wrote: Jill...sounds to me like your dh is terrified.  He doesn't want to accept what is happening.  Maybe if you suggest he go to counseling with you, telling him you need it, he would go.  My husband and I went to couples counseling before we got married and I think it was one of the best things we could have done.  It's so easy to get things out in the open when a third party, that is not judgmental, is involved.  You need support now...more than ever.  My thoughts and prayers are with you and your dh...I spent many years alone (emotionally).  I'm glad you have your mother.
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2009 06:20PM mooma wrote: I'm here too!!!  I have gone back to work.  I told my dh last night I haven't seen my friends....lol  He didn't know what I was talking about....This site has been a life saver for me.  I wish I could meet all of you.  Weather here is always good...I live in Florida...no complaints.  At least not until July when the humidity shoots up! I'm still waiting for my first fill.  I still have a little necrosis and he isn't going to fill until that's gone.  I have an appointment for Thursday but might have to change that...ugh!
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2009 07:44PM mooma wrote: 2new1's and dani...I bought a champion bra yesterday, too!  I found one that fit perfect at Sports Authority.  I tried so many on...my dh was checking all of them out for me...bless his heart!  My ps told me not to wear one either but I've been going to the gym and I need something when I'm on the treadmill. caligrl...hope your appointment goes well and you leave there feeling great!  I had trouble with my right side (my good side that I had done prophylacticlly) had a hard time healing.  It still is the side that gives me the most problems...go figure!  I'm hoping to get my first fill on Thursday but I still have a small area that isn't healed so I don't know if he will do it.
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2009 04:42AM mooma wrote:  Hello everyone....I haven't been here in a while.  Just long enough to read some entries to keep up with everyone but not enough time to post anything...back to the real world is hard stuff.  I always have this safe feeling being in here.  I wanted to wish you all a very Happy Easter!  I know someone had a question about a muscle relaxer but I can't find it now.  Skelaxin is the muscle relaxer my ps prescribes.  It doesn't make you drowsy.  I was going to get some when I was having some shooting pains, right after surgery but it was $50 even with my insurance so I didn't get it.  2new1s....my dh went with me for my first fill.  I already had 300cc's at surgery so I didn't think it would make that much difference.  WELL....I got another 120 and we watched that little foob grow into a big foob!  My dh is not a man of much expression (in his face), he's a nurse so he doesn't show shock...well, he certainly did show expression as he watched my foob grow!  So, I now have 420 cc's and don't think I can go any bigger.  Dh and ps both think this is perfect so he will put another 60 in next week and then the wait, 3 months, for the exchange.  He is going to bring them closer together when I have my exchange to create some cleavage.  Right now they just look like two big balls!  We are going on a cruise in May so I tried on some of my bathing suites from the before bc days (A cup)....oh, what a laugh we had!
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2009 02:38PM mooma wrote: I got my last fill today...and it will be my last one.  I couldn't deal with anything bigger than what I'm looking at right now....I look like a cartoon character! Dani and TXBadboob...I asked my ps about the shrinking and he laughed! lol  He said it feels like it after the muscle starts to relax.  Well, I can't wait for these muscles to start relaxing this time! Stacy....4:30 am!!!!  Oh...to be young again!  Happy, happy, happy for you!!
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2009 03:15PM mooma wrote: Dani...you are just too funny!!  Saran Wrap???  lol  I'm always thinking I'm the only one doing things like that! Hope...I believe you need to go with your instincts, too.  I started out with one surgeon and made a switch.  Something just didn't feel right with him.  As it turned out he never would have found the other cancer I had so I am so so thankful.  When it came time for the ps, I did the same thing.  It may have turned out fine with the first one but I feel 100% comfortable with the one I'm with now.  NEVER DOUBT A WOMAN...that's what they say!

Dani...you make me laugh!!  I was thinking of mine as octopus tentacles but I like utters...new name for my drains...utters.  At least our foobs won't look like utters!!  I wear a chami, snug fitting and that seems to make me more comfortable.  I'm putting out about the same cc's...my ps said that is normal but my blood looks light pink now.  I can't wait for them to be gone!  Ya, jillisucat....the fat will be gone but I'm worried about the skin left behind!! lol

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2009 04:48AM mooma wrote: 2new1's...What a blessing for you and your dad!  As far as 16 year old boys, there is no easy answer for one that is mesmerized by some sexy, hot, young girls!  I think the only thing worse is to be on the other side of the fence and own the 16 year old girl...been there, done that...boy & girl.  I-yi-yi!  Believe it or not...this too shall pass!  My youngest daughter started when she was 14!  She's now 23 and just got back on track!   Cali....once again, you are a smart gal.  You are in charge and if they aren't right for you, just move on and say....NEXT!  I did that for many years before I found the man that was perfect for me. Bee54...that's wonderful news about your flipper...and you got a bonus by being able to spend a great day with your dh!  Congrats on your dd's achievement!! Dani...I know how you feel.  I wanted to go bigger, as well, but my ps and my dh both agreed I shouldn't push it any more.  I will end up a cup larger so I am happy about that.  I feel very sure God has everything under control so I'm in a good place right now.  I don't get on here much any more but you are all in my prayers every night and I'm convinced this website has been the best thing that has happened to me since I was diagnosed! Love and hugs to all of you!

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2009 04:59AM mooma wrote: Well, I'm back to this side!  Like Dianne said, the fear was much worse then the procedure.  The worst pain for me was waking up after surgery but as soon as they got some morphine in me I was fine.  I had a private room, as well.  I guess allot of my treatment had to do with the fact my dh works at the hospital I was in.  The only goof up was when the anestesist's assistant went to put my IV in and someone said my dh was part of the vasc team...she got nervous and missed so a doctor came over and put it in.  Yes, to chapstick and narcotics!  I also felt great the next morning...until my ride home, so don't be afraid to ask for something for the ride.   My breasts look like they did when I was nursing and trying to dry up....and my right one, the one I had done prophetically, burns inside my nipple...has anyone else experienced that?  It feels like it might have something to do with the nerves. My prayers are with each and everyone of you on your way!
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2009 07:35PM mooma wrote: Welcome back suegmom!  You have made it through the worst of it, I think.  I had a hard time with pain after surgery, as well.  Also had a great nurse and a great private duty nurse..my dh!  I had a catheter so I didn't need to keep getting up to go to the bathroom with all the water I was drinking because of the 'cotton mouth'.   I wanted to take the catheter home with me! Dianne, I heard of the Vajaja thing.  I'm not sure I could do that but it does make sense to me.       My daughter is leaving in the morning; it has been so nice having her here, not only to help but just to be able to sit around and talk on a one on one with her.  She lives in AZ so I don't get to see her as often as I'd like.  All my kids were over for dinner tonight which was really nice.

Good for you Dianne...I started walking two days ago, not at the gym but outside, and have felt so much better.  I'm still on ES Tylenol, too.  I took a pain pill last night because I over did it.  My worst time is after sleeping for several hours and then trying to get up.  I have to hold my breasts and let go slowly because it feels like they are scrapping inside my chest.  Does anyone else have this problem?  Makes me not want to even go to sleep!

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2009 07:50PM mooma wrote: Hello Girls... I got my drains out on the 4th and it felt soooooo good!!!  When I got home my friend from long ago was at my house waiting for me...she came to 'help' me.  Well, I have been cooking and doing dishes ever since she came.  Been to the grocery store twice in the last couple of days, too.  Not to mention she has acquired this new habit of talking non stop.  I can't take it any more!  When my dh is around she jumps up when I start to do something to warn me I shouldn't be doing that (she is a nurse, too).  I am soooo over this.  She is leaving Sunday and I am supposed to go back to work Sunday.  I'm so sorry...I just needed to vent.  I would have much rather spent my last couple of days reading and responding to you girls!! Dianne....boob greed???  LOL  I love it!!
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2009 04:30AM mooma wrote: Hey girls...hope all is well.  So much happens when you are gone for a few days!  I'm reading and trying to catch up.  Dani and Jillisucat....you are both so, so adorable!  I love the pics! Caligrlof68...you sound like a very wise woman!  I can relate because I went through the same thing but, unlike you, I wasn't in the middle of this 'nightmare' on top of it.  You need all of your energy to focus on yourself, not some a#$.  My ex did the fishing thing too...that was fine until he started fishing for the two legged bimbos!  Keep up the good work...you know you can hold your head high.  Believe it or not, if you chose, there are good men out there.  I am, after 13 years of being single, married to an incredible man.

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2009 03:46PM mooma wrote: My560sel....yes...get another opinion!!  I got three before I made a decision! Bee54...Usually those kinds of things happen to me! lol  I love Dani's pun "turn around". 2new1's...I have allot of empty space on my chest because I had nipple sparing and I'm thin.  Well, not thin enough to have no tummy...just thin enough not to have enough fat in my tummy for a flap.  Anyway, my ps is going to suck fat out of my tummy and place it in my chest to fill any empty cavities!!  Do you know how happy that made me???  I run, work out with weights and eat extremely healthy.  The worst thing I do is my glass of wine with dinner at night.  I can not get ride of this pouch I have.  So, I would consider a tt if I wasn't getting this done.  The only thing I'm worried about is the skin left behind.  He said it won't be a problem but I will have to convince him he'll need to tuck it.

Posts.Content: May 4, 2009 11:33AM mooma wrote: my560sel, When I had my bm, Feb. 23, I had nipple sparing w/expanders and my ps filled my expanders with the same amount of cc's the fat from my breasts weighed.  I looked like I did back when I was nursing, when I came out of surgery, because of the swelling.  I was just happy I looked like myself.  I've had 2 fills since and now they just look like round balls...I know some women who had saline implants years ago and this is how they looked...and they paid for it! lol

Posts.Content: May 21, 2009 04:27AM mooma wrote: You are right, jillisucat.  Many of us are moving on because we are healing. This thread has been the most important support I have received!  Thank you so much for starting it.  I, too, check and read....just don't post so much.  I still think of this thread as my favorite 'place' to go!  I have my exchange date...July 27th....seems so far away but I know it will come quickly.  Blessings to all!
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2009 07:00AM mooma wrote: Dani...I'm so happy your good day back to work!  Isn't it funny how we are just like little girls with our new girls?!?  Well, I came out with flying colors yesterday!  They seem to have nice shape but I can still see the implant under my skin....could any of you?  I've never heard anyone say anything about that...is that what you mean by fluffing?  Duh...lol  My ps lowered the nipple that was higher so they would match a little better.  I actually would have liked him to make the lower one higher but at this stage of the game I'm not complaining about that!  My ps says NO bra.  My incision is under my breast so he said no bra until that is healed.  While I was in surgery someone burnt my arm with the lazar...I think that hurts more than anything.  Over the past two years I have worked so hard to get my arms in shape and now I might end up with a big ugly scar!  I have a before pic on the picture forum and I will add some after soon.  I wish I could have shared pics sooner so I might have helped someone else.
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2009 07:21AM mooma wrote: Carolyn...I'm right there with you.  I was diagnosed Nov. 10th.  I had two tumors.  One cancer the other benign.  I had a MRI on the benign one and another mammogram, ultra sound and another biopsy.  They all came back neg.  The surgeon I saw the first time, I had an uneasy feeling with.  Went with a different one and the morning of my surgery, Christmas Eve morning, he decided to take another piece of the second tumor....just for reassurance.  It turned out to be cancerous.  There is no doubt God is in control here! lol  Now I'm facing a mastectomy, as well.  I just wanted to tell you this little story because I feel so strongly about choosing the right surgeon.
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed with Cancer Carolyn2008 Carolyn2008

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2009 10:34PM mooma wrote: Mamie2,  I hope all has gone well for you.  Didn't they do the sentinel node biopsy when they did the lumpectomy?  I can't believe all the different treatment procedures I hear...I guess you had that done last week...how did it turn out?
Posts.Title: Anyone have an MRI core Biopsy? I need one. shabby6485 green71364

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2009 07:11AM mooma wrote: Mamie2...My surgery is tentatively scheduled for Feb. 23rd; that would be a bm.  I'm seeing a 2nd ps on the 5th and I'm hoping he's the one!  I've heard so many good things about him.  The first ps I saw suggested immediate implants, which is ok with me but I had the feeling he didn't have much experience with any of the other procedures because of the way he answered my questions.  So, at this point I'm not really sure of the type of recon I'll be having. I have all my reports...right from the beginning of this crazy journey.  That's excellent advice for everyone.
Posts.Title: Anyone have an MRI core Biopsy? I need one. shabby6485 green71364

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2009 08:02AM mooma wrote:  Mamie2 I noticed your post because of your name...Mamie/Mame are my nicknames!  Is that your real name?  I was just diagnosed, as well and have a similar story. I was diagnosed Nov. 10th.  I had a stereotactic biopsy on two areas of my left breast.  One diagnosed as invasive duct carcinoma and they found nothing on the other spot.  I had an MRI on the benign one and another mammogram, ultra sound and another biopsy.  They all came back neg. The first biopsy I had was after the MRI and the OR that did it missed the spot.  She then did it guided by ultrasound and got it but it came back benign.  The cancer wasn't detected until my OS did a biopsy during my lumpectomy on another cancer.  Very confusing and I don't want to scare you I just want everyone to take advantage of as much info as they can get so nothing goes amiss.  On the morning of my surgery, Christmas Eve morning, my surgeon (who was my second opinion surgeon I decided to go with...thank you Lord)  decided to take another piece of the second tumor....just for reassurance.  It turned out to be cancerous.  Now I will be having a mastectomy and recon.  You will be in my thoughts and prayers Friday!
Posts.Title: Anyone have an MRI core Biopsy? I need one. shabby6485 green71364
